items.sentence: Don\'t forget that you need to buy some onions.
I was bitten by a lot of insects in the forest.
It was very kind of you to lend me an umbrella.
One million people lost their lives in the war.
Tom moved his chair a little closer to Mary\'s.
Tom probably knows how to get to Mary\'s house.
We often have barbecue parties in our backyard.
Tom was executed for a crime he didn\'t commit.
I would like to sit in the non-smoking section.
Tom didn\'t want to hear anything I had to say.
There\'s a lot of traffic here in the mornings.
You have to wear a helmet to protect your head.
Tom left work early, complaining of a headache.
Tom may come and visit me any time he wants to.
Tom put the spare tire in the trunk of his car.
Tom reached for his glasses on the night stand.
Tom realized that Mary might be a little upset.
How do you know Tom won\'t want you to do that?
Tom pretended to agree that it was a good plan.
Tom probably thought I was allergic to peanuts.
